text: The 2019 Chengdu Challenger was a professional tennis tournament played on hard courts. It was the 4th edition of the tournament which was part of the 2019 ATP Challenger Tour. It took place in Chengdu, China between 29 July and 4 August 2019. ==Singles main draw entrants== ===Seeds=== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- ! width="70"| Country ! width="175"| Player ! Rank1 ! Seed |- | |James Duckworth |145 |1 |- | |Chung Hyeon |154 |2 |- | |Tatsuma Ito |157 |3 |- | |Zhang Ze |216 |4 |- | |Chung Yun-seong |233 |5 |- | |Yūichi Sugita |241 |6 |- | |Gonçalo Oliveira |252 |7 |- | |Saketh Myneni |264 |8 |- | |Wu Tung- lin |284 |9 |- | |Nam Ji-sung |291 |10 |- | |Zhang Zhizhen |300 |11 |- | |Yang Tsung-hua |301 |12 |- | |Brydan Klein |346 |13 |- | |Wu Di |353 |14 |- | |Xia Zihao |361 |15 |- | |Bai Yan |368 |16 |} * 1 Rankings are as of 22 July 2019. ===Other entrants=== The following players received wildcards into the singles main draw: * Li Wenmao * Liu Hanyi * Wang Chuhan * Wang Chukang * Zheng Wei Qiang The following players received entry into the singles main draw using their ITF World Tennis Ranking: * Courtney John Lock * Issei Okamura * Vladyslav Orlov * Kento Takeuchi * Evan Zhu The following players received entry from the qualifying draw: * Gong Maoxin * Toshihide Matsui ==Champions== ===Singles=== * Chung Hyeon def. Yūichi Sugita 6–4, 6–3 ===Doubles=== * Arjun Kadhe / Saketh Myneni def. Nam Ji-sung / Song Min-kyu 6–3, 0–6, [10–6]. ==References== Chengdu Challenger 2019 Category:2019 in Chinese sport Category:July 2019 sports events in China Category:August 2019 sports events in China
title: 2019 Chengdu Challenger
